column4: I'd really like to give back to the community, but all I have is basic (very very basic) java understanding. I kinda doubt I'm knowledgable enough to do package management. Where should I fit in?
how-to's?
not needed,.just use install --> and use entire disk
'Twas my second suggestion :)
ye sorry,.,.didnt et there in time ;~)
Heh. Now question: What do you mean by how-tos?
It's kinda hard to pick a how to that hasn't been written yet. A BUTT ton of things have already been documented on ubuntu-forums
write specific step-by-step documentation on how to do something
or how about art?
I know when I see something's ascetically pleasing. That's about as far as my art-savyness goes :)
give me feedback ,.,.lol,.,. http://s258.photobucket.com/albums/hh275/Bodsda/
Hehe, psychadelic(h). :). I'm not a huge fan of lense flares as my background. That would look nice as a splash screen (the ubuntu ones). The tux ones are interesting, too :)
lad you like 'em :~),.,. so have you decided how to "ive back" ?
I'm still not sure. I can always clown around in the IRC room. But I dunno.'
thats what i do,. im thinking of ding some more art, but im not really that interested in it,.,;~)
Hehe.
When I gain a better understanding of networking stuff, then I think I'll really be able to contribute.
im learning python,.,.can you programme?
networkin is only 1 thing in a long line of problems people have on a daily bases
I'm learning Java in a uni class right now for info sci. So I can *kinda* program
why not write some java things,. like an ubuntu themed game or summit,.,.lol
Why doesn't ubuntu emulate 5.1 sound like windows does?
because it doesnt want to be assosciated with windows
when I attempt to play something in 5.1 sound (Like off a dvd), I get choppy sound and a "broken pipe" error in the console. Any idea what that's about?
